page.title: 19Transport
page.content: The roads in Stevenage seem to be very well designed. There are not many traffic jams and according to Police reports the number of accidents are low. This has been achieved by careful planning so that roads do not all meet in one central place. Instead of having a star shaped pattern, the roads form a series of loops. Other features which help the traffic to keep moving are special cycle tracks, lots of underpasses and roundabouts instead of traffic lights. All of these help to keep the traffic flowing. The town planners also helped when designing the town by using the A1(M) as a sort of by-pass to the town and by keeping heavy lorries away from normal town roads. This was done by separating the industrial zones from the housing areas.
